meanings.definition: To save more money than is necessary or prudent.
meanings.sent1: She kept oversaving her allowance, never spending any of it.
meanings.sent2: He tends to oversave for emergencies, which is a good habit.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was oversaving nuts for the winter, filling every corner of its nest.
meanings.sent4: Her oversaving was like a dam holding back a river of expenses.
meanings.sent5: Oversaving can sometimes lead to missing out on enjoying the present.

meanings.sent1: His oversaving was evident from the stacks of untouched money in his room.
meanings.sent2: Oversaving can sometimes be a sign of anxiety about the future.
meanings.sent3: The oversaving of paper clips in the office drawer was a running joke among the staff.
meanings.sent4: Her oversaving of old newspapers made her house look like a recycling center.
meanings.sent5: The oversaving of resources in the game made it impossible to progress to the next level.
